snippet: Yoko Ono and her son, Sean Lennon, whose family farm is upstate, delivered to the governor’s office what they said were 204,000 comments against hydraulic fracturing.
abstract: Yoko Ono and son Sean Lennon join with other environmental advocates in fight against hydraulic fracturing in New York State; group travels to Albany to deliver to Gov Andrew M Cuomo and state's Department of Environmental Conservation 50 boxes of anti-drilling comments from some 204,000 New York residents; Lennon says family opposition to drilling began with concerns about its own upstate farm.
lead_paragraph: Yoko Ono and her son, Sean Lennon, whose family farm is upstate, delivered to the governor’s office what they said were 204,000 comments against hydraulic fracturing.

headline.seo: Yoko Ono, in Albany, Raises Her Voice Against Hydraulic Fracturing
headline.main: Yoko Ono Takes Fight Against Gas Drilling to Albany
headline.print_headline: Yoko Ono Takes Fight Against Gas Drilling to Albany
